Posts.Content: Jan 30, 2011 02:25PM yucky31 wrote: The answer to chainsawz question. I live in canada so the trial will only let me be on the pills. If the pills stop working they will do other treatments. I go back in 3 months to see what they will do next.
Posts.Title: New Girl yucky31 Windtalker

Posts.Content: yucky31 wrote: Hello, I was 31 and thought I had a cold. Months later I could not walk up my stairs because I could not breathe. Had lung surgery and told me I had stage 4 bc with mets to the lungs. I did chemo 5 times and had a bad reaction. They offered me a clinic trial to try Tykerb. For the last year all I did was take 5 pills a day. 2 months ago they have me taking 6 pills a day! What a great treatment plan. The other day I had my year check up. They told me my lungs are clear and my breast tumour is gone!! I have a stubborn lymph node that we are trying to keep stable. Every morning I come here and read peoples great post. I wanted to say hi to everyone. Dx 1/28/2010, IDC, 2cm, Stage IV, mets, ER+, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: New Girl yucky31 Windtalker
